q: " A COMMITTEE TO REDUCE SPENDING? Mike Pence Jeff Duncan ( R-S.C.) plans to introduce legislation to create a "committee on nonessential federal expenditures," according to an alert passed along by a source. The committee would be based on the` Byrd Committee' proposed by Senator Harry Byrd( D-VA) in the 77th Congress. That committee is credited with saving taxpayers$ 38 billion( in inflation adjusted dollars) during its existence. The committee would be unique in that its sole purpose would be to reduce federal spending. Mike Pence shuts 1 door, leaves another open U.S. Mike Pence shut the door Thursday on seeking the presidency in 2012 but left unanswered whether his choice instead is the Indiana Eric Holcomb 's office. I'm open to running for Eric Holcomb , Mike Pence said in an exclusive interview with The Indianapolis Star. "We're going to take the next several months to travel across the state and hear what Hoosiers have to say. We'll seriously consider it.
